title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1625-6.6 - Retention of records and correspondence
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1625-6.6 - Retention of records and correspondence

State Regulations
(a) Records and correspondence shall be
retained until such time as authority's requests for destruction of specific
records or correspondence are approved by the division or as such destruction
is otherwise authorized. (b) Transfer of records and correspondence from active files to inactive storage of
authority shall be undertaken as warranted. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1625-6.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
